page.title: 02Cowtons in the 20th Century
page.content: 'Cowtons' is a collective word to cover 3 parishes in this area. The largest is the expanding East Cowton, with a population of 600. North Cowton has a population of 350, and lastly South Cowton which covers the hamlet of Atley Hill and the Pepper Arden estate. The countryside is mainly flat, with a few gentle hills. It is mostly farm land, there being 12 major farms in the area. Apart from sport the main villages are fairly independant of each other and rarely meet for joint activities. The District boundary divides the area. E Cowton is in the Hambleton District and N & S Cowtons in the Richmondshire District. Thus the secondary school children attend schools in their respective districts and rarely come into contact.
